ygData.subject: RE: A tale of woe.
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh heh, I m with ya in spirit man!  I d say though that tailors too would dearly love to find a source of HQ wolf pelts to outfit all those halfling druids
ygData.messageBody:
Heh heh, I'm with ya in spirit man! I'd say though that tailors too would
dearly love to find a source of HQ wolf pelts to outfit all those halfling
druids with reinforced leather. I've seen one in all my lifetimes!

Leagnomo of E'ci

From: Brad Balatgek <gazamel@...>

About diamond dust.. someone on our server knows
where to get it. They won't tell anyone. I've looked
all over too, and I can't find it. I have heard that
there are NPC's who will cut/crush gems for you if you
give them a gem. I don't know where these folks are
either.

Time will tell, these things will be turn up, and then
we'll be able to perform our trade like the other
tradesman out there, who never have to worry about
finding their components. /rude Verant

Gazamel Prime - Solusek Ro
Dealers of Death


--- Andy Smith <AndyS@...> wrote:
> Another thought (just as expensive), perhaps you put
> the diamond in the
> toolkit by itself (or with something else), you can
> reduce it to diamond
> dust. I'd hope something like that would be trivial
> at all levels (like
> silk swatches from silk). I mean, if you failed
> what would it produce (err,
> carbon filings?).
>
> I think it's more likely that the dust just isn't in
> the game yet.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
> Just a really expensive thought, but has anyone
> tried using a diamond?
> Maybe it gets turned to dust in the process. Its
> probably off base but with
> so much searching and no finding you have to wonder.
>
<HR>
<html>
>
